projects.title: Random quote generator
projects.description: A simple Javascript project, using basic JavaScript syntax, variables, loops and conditionals that displays randomly generated quotes.

projects.title: Pagination and filtering
projects.description: Demonstration of content pagination and incremental filtering

projects.title: Interactive Form
projects.description: Interactive registration form. Demonstrates user input validation and error message display when the user enters invalid information into the form fields.

projects.title: Phrase hunter
projects.description: Game similar to the Hangman word game where the user needs to guess the letters of the hidden word.

projects.title: API requests
projects.description: The project is implemented both with vanilla Javascript and jQuery and it includes asynchronous REST API calls. It's an an app for a fictional company, with remote employees working all over the world. For the employees' data, the Random User API is used.

projects.title: DARSSY Air Traffic Control Radar Simulator
projects.description: A single webpage representing the air traffic control radar simulator DARSSY. It displays information about what the simulator offers and current installations.

projects.title: Kdiet Nutrition (Greek)
projects.description: The web site was created for a nutritionist's office, named Kdiet, located in Thessaloniki, Greece. It provides information about its services and different nutrition packages. The webpage is not live anymore and the link for the live demo redirects to a link from Wayback Machine.

projects.title: Villa Sofia renting rooms (Greek and English)
projects.description: The webpage was created for a family run rooms to let in Nea Vrasna, Greece. It was a single page project and it is not live anymore. The link for the live demo redirects to a link from Wayback Machine.

projects.title: Gallery app with Flickr API
projects.description: Gallery application, using the Flickr API, to present images associated with the user's search tags. It is implemented with React and it includes React Routing, React class components, asynchronous REST API calls with Axios and 404 page redirection. The application was deployed with Netlify.

projects.title: Library manager
projects.description: This project is a web application that includes pages to list, add, update, and delete books. The books are are shown with pagination and search functionality is also available. The books can be filtered by title, author, genre or year.

projects.title: Full stack school courses library
projects.description: For this project, with the use of React for the front-end, a client is implemented for an existing school database REST API. The full stack application provides a way for users to administer a school database containing information about courses: users can interact with the database by retrieving a list of courses, viewing detail for a specific course, as well as creating, updating and deleting courses in the database. For the actions of creation, update and deletion of a course, there must be a logged-in user. In case there isn't, the app redirects to the Sign-in page and after successful log-in, the user is returned to the page he tried to visit previously.

projects.title: Calculator
projects.description: One of my very first projects. The styling is a replica (as close as possible) of the calculator that I actually use at home. It covers the basic arithmetic operations: addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. It also includes place in Memory, reciprocal, square power and root calculation.

projects.title: Review registry app
projects.description: I implemented this project in Angular Js. It's an application used for giving rated feedback for a service or product. The app contains a form for submitting the feedback, a page with all the reviews available and a page per review, for displaying the whole content of the feedback and its comments.

projects.title: Shirts for Mike
projects.description: I implemented this project in Next Js for the front-end part of the application and Express Js for the REST API. It's a small e-shop app (not yet completed) which shows all the products available, a page per product with detailed information and a search page. I used PostgreSQL this time for storing the data.
